info.name: CPS
info.description: # [CPS ONAP Documentation](https://docs.onap.org/projects/onap-cps/en/latest/index.html) # [DMI ONAP Documentation](https://docs.onap.org/projects/onap-cps-ncmp-dmi-plugin/en/latest/index.html) ### How-to Build CPS docker images with maven: `mvn clean install` or `mvn clean install -DskipTests` Navigate to docker-compose folder: `cd .\docker-compose\` Bring up docker containers using commands found in docker-compose.yaml or run CPS services including dmi plugin `docker-compose --profile dmi-service up -d` ### CPS-Enviroment To enable the CPS enviroment, go to the top right of the screen in Postman and click envrioments. Import the CPS-envrioment file from the Postman Collections file in CPS. **To utilise NCMP-DMI-Stub endpoints begin the docker containers with:** `docker-compose --profile dmi-stub --profile monitoring up -d` # CPS Core Example - Create dataspace - Verify dataspace exists - etc... # CPS-NCMP Example - Create CM handles - Verify CM handles exist - etc...

item.name: CPS-Core
CPS-Admin

request.description: Read a dataspace given a dataspace name
Make sure in the body there is form data. key = file and value will be the zip/yang file.
Read a schema set given a schema set name and a dataspace
Read all schema sets, given a dataspace
Read all anchors, given a dataspace
Read all anchors, given a dataspace
Make sure in the body there is form data. key = file and value will be the zip/yang file.

item.description: Some endpoints of CPS-ADMIN not mentioned in the CPS-CORE folder

item.name: Get node category by key, direct descendants only
Query path leaf condition, all descendants

item.description:
CPS-Core endpoints as defined by Rest OpenApi Specification [here](https://docs.onap.org/projects/onap-cps/en/latest/design.html#cps-core)

To perform this functionality execute the API calls in order to create a dataspace, schema set (file is provided), anchor, and data node. Then GET the nodes to retrieve the information. The APIs in CPS-ADMIN can be used after initial POST requests.

## Running the collection

To run the requests in the collection simply select the request and click send. "Create Schema Set" in "CPS-CORE" requires a file to send the request. Example files are provided: "bookstore.yang" and "bookstore-types.yang" (these files must be zipped before adding them to the request)

bookstore-model.yang can be found at cps/postman-collections/bookstore-model.yang
